original_title: Open Source OLED Nametag is Full of Features
original_content:
Ever wanted a sweet OLED nametag with fancy features like daylight readability, automatic brightness adjustment, GIF animation support, all-day runtime, easy web interface, and more? [TobleMiner]s OLED Nametag is the project you want to keep an eye on in that case.
Its still an early prototype, but the feature list looks great and works with a variety of OLED modules that are easily available. The enclosure can be 3D printed, and while there is very little spare room inside the housing, [TobleMiner] has clearly made the most of all available space. Some PCB fab houses offer component placement these days, and the board is designed with exactly that in mind.
Weve seen a batteryless E-paper display make a serviceable nametag in the past, and while those offer high contrast and wide viewing angles, they lack the sort of features this project is bursting at the seams with. Affordable access to good components and the ability to have high-quality PCBs made on demand has really raised the bar in terms of what a hacker project can work with in recent years, and we love to see it expressed in projects like this one.
title: 「高機能な日中でも読みやすいOLEDネームタグの製作方法」
body: OLED Nametagはユーザー自身が作れるスウィートなネームタグで、日中でも読みやすく、自動的に明るさを調節し、GIFアニメーションをサポートしており、終日動作し、簡単なウェブインターフェースも備えています。プロジェクトはまだ早期の段階ですが、多くの利用可能なOLEDモジュールと互換性があります。筐体は3Dプリントで作成可能で、PCBファブハウスも部品の配置を提供しています。以前にもバッテリーレスのE-paperディスプレイが使われたことがありますが、このプロジェクトには欠けている機能もあります。しかし、手頃な価格の優れたコンポーネントやオンデマンドで高品質なPCBを製作できる環境が整い、近年のハッカープロジェクトの可能性が広がっています。
